incidents.name: Issue Loading Some UI Elements to Create Customer Profiles and a Few Trust Products

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Telenor Pakistan

This incident causing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to the Telenor network in Pakistan was prematurely resolved in one of our previous posts. Please refer to https://status.twilio.com/incidents/w90s1y2wh70z for previous updates. We are continuing to experience SMS delivery delays when sending messages to the Telenor network in Pakistan. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available. We apologize for the inconvenience and for any confusion this may have caused

incidents.name: Twilio Console Error for Users Attempting to Access Using Ad Blockers

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved and user console is operating normally at this time.
We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

The Twilio console is now operating normally. We had a number of customers using ad blockers experience an error seeing a blank screen when attempting to access the Twilio console. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with users console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: MMS to SMS fallback messages affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio MMS to SMS fallback messages were affected by a deployment on Thursday, June 6th, starting at 3:30 PM Pacific Time. As a result, SMS messages were delivered without the media URL. The root cause has been identified, and a rollback is currently in progress.

incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues

incident_updates.body: We are now seeing full recovery, this incident has now been resolved.

We are continuing to observe data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. This recent impact is limited to devices connected over one provider in the US. About 5% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console or through the APIs (by reactivating SIMs) if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner as soon as we have more information available.

We are continuing to observe data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Beginning at 04:58 UTC, we observed ~11.57% of data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating an issue with Notify Log Data

incidents.name: Twilio Whatsapp Cloud API and Verify Affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Whatsapp Cloud API and Verify were degraded for 23 minutes between 17:11 and 17:34 Pacific Time on 06/04/2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced rate limit errors (63018). The issue has now been resolved

incidents.name: Missing Subscriptions From Event Streams API

incident_updates.body: Event Streams API and console are working normally. All existing subscriptions are now returned. This incident has been resolved.

Event Streams API and console are working normally. All existing subscriptions are now returned. We will continue to monitor to ensure full service recovery. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Event Streams subscriptions created during or before 2022 are not returned to the API, CLI or console since May 12th 2024. Event Streams engineers are working to mitigate the issue. Event delivery is working for all subscriptions. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as we have more information.

Customers experiencing missing subscriptions in the API and console in Event Streams. Event delivery is not impacted. Our engineers are working on the issue, and we will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
